message_1:
A traveling salesman needs to visit 5 different cities. The distance (in miles) between each city is given below. What is the shortest possible route he can take to visit all 5 cities and return to the starting city?

City A to City B: 10 miles
City A to City C: 15 miles
City A to City D: 20 miles
City A to City E: 12 miles
City B to City C: 8 miles
City B to City D: 25 miles
City B to City E: 18 miles
City C to City D: 14 miles
City C to City E: 7 miles
City D to City E: 16 miles
message_2:
To find the shortest possible route, we can use the brute force method by listing all possible routes and calculating their total distances. Since there are 5 cities, there are 4! (4 factorial) or 24 possible routes, as the salesman must start and end at the same city. We will list the routes and their total distances:

1. A-B-C-D-E-A: 10+8+14+16+12 = 60 miles
2. A-B-C-E-D-A: 10+8+7+16+20 = 61 miles
3. A-B-D-C-E-A: 10+25+14+7+12 = 68 miles
4. A-B-D-E-C-A: 10+25+16+7+15 = 73 miles
5. A-B-E-C-D-A: 10+18+7+14+20 = 69 miles
6. A-B-E-D-C-A: 10+18+16+14+15 = 73 miles
7. A-C-B-D-E-A: 15+8+25+16+12 = 76 miles
8. A-C-B-E-D-A: 15+8+18+16+20 = 77 miles
9. A-C-D-B-E-A: 15+14+25+18+12 = 84 miles
10. A-C-D-E-B-A: 15+14+16+18+10 = 73 miles
11. A-C-E-B-D-A: 15+7+18+25+20 = 85 miles
12. A-C-E-D-B-A: 15+7+16+25+10 = 73 miles
13. A-D-B-C-E-A: 20+25+8+7+12 = 72 miles
14. A-D-B-E-C-A: 20+25+18+7+15 = 85 miles
15. A-D-C-B-E-A: 20+14+8+18+12 = 72 miles
16. A-D-C-E-B-A: 20+14+7+18+10 = 69 miles
17. A-D-E-B-C-A: 20+16+18+8+15 = 77 miles
18. A-D-E-C-B-A: 20+16+7+8+10 = 61 miles
19. A-E-B-C-D-A: 12+18+8+14+20 = 72 miles
20. A-E-B-D-C-A: 12+18+25+14+15 = 84 miles
21. A-E-C-B-D-A: 12+7+8+25+20 = 72 miles
22. A-E-C-D-B-A: 12+7+14+25+10 = 68 miles
23. A-E-D-B-C-A: 12+16+25+8+15 = 76 miles
24. A-E-D-C-B-A: 12+16+14+8+10 = 60 miles

The shortest possible route is either route 1 (A-B-C-D-E-A) or route 24 (A-E-D-C-B-A), both with a total distance of 60 miles.
